TopicTitle: They Never Went to the Mun

Articles.Content: Yup, RCS tank with Poodle engine. Clearly KASA faked the Munlandings.

:clapping gif:

Great job Squad.
I knew it !
We can't see what as attached to the nose. It could be that there are lfo tanks attached there.

Puddle was supposed to power the landing and ascent stage

Puddle, you say?

Look! Water! There MUST be life on the Moon! And the Death Star! And a secret human army base! And an alien civilization with reasonable Photoshop skills!

Squad wins Best Indie golden joystick award. --> Community complains about engine fuel tank pair up in the picture.

Edit: Partial joke/sarcasm.

Edited November 1, 2015 by Robotengineer
Spellings. Do not comment while drowsy.
They used HyperEdit!

Squad wins Best Indie golden joystick award. --> Community companies about engine fuel tank pair up in the picture.
Also complains about their one-of-a-kind space sim being constantly portrayed as a glorified disaster sim. Great job, Squid!

Community companies[sic] about engine fuel tank pair up in the picture.

I can assure you that I, the poster of the thread, did not contact the Community prior to posting. Its not a complaint really, just slightly poking fun (that Mono tank is cooler looking that the LFO equivalent) and mashing it up with our friendly neighborhood Moon Landing Conspiracy types that are so prevalent on the internet. No Kerbals or Mexican computer game developers were harmed in the posting of the thread!

Also complains about their one-of-a-kind space sim being constantly portrayed as a glorified disaster sim. Great job, Squid!

Lel, Squid. A very valid complaint, sadly.

Yup, RCS tank with Poodle engine. Clearly KASA faked the Munlandings.

ITS NOT A MISTAKE!!!

Thats why they couldnt land safely. the stage that brought them to the mun was jettisoned a Long time ago and they couldnt slow down with that fuel/engine, so they crashed

You guys have to use your mind fantasy

Edited November 1, 2015 by MalfunctionM1Ke
Explains why it's upside down now, dunnit?

I think Kerbin is backwards, too. That seems a common affliction in KSP renderings, mainly because the texture map is reversed left to right ingame, so extracting the map gives you something mirrored from what it actually looks like ingame.
Or possibly it was Maxmap's first Mun lander

I think Kerbin is backwards, too. That seems a common affliction in KSP renderings, mainly because the texture map is reversed left to right ingame, so extracting the map gives you something mirrored from what it actually looks like ingame.

Yup, it is definitely inverted. I knew there was something wrong with that Kerbin as soon as put the eyes on it, but couldn't put the finger on it

Anyway I was going to say that atleast this was a better work than the old Mun starting screen ( that was also as fake as it could be ) , but nope : the lander and the kerbal are iluminated by atleast two diferent sources of light and Kerbin, besides being inverted, somehow got a axial tilt ( and it is summer on the northern hemisphere ), Squad, can't you even fake things right ?
I don't know if they went to the moon, but... with that rig, and the nose buried in the soil, they're sure not coming back.
Perhaps they used one of those mods that lets you change tank contents.
